title.rendered: A Guide to Targeted Express Entry for Architects 2023

[vc_column_text]“Can I immigrate to Canada as an Architect with Category-Based Targeted Express Entry?”

Yes! It is possible to move to Canada as an architect or architecture and science manager through the Targeted Express Entry Canada program. Recognizing the significance of architecture in the nation’s development, the Canadian government has introduced the Targeted Express Entry program, offering immigration opportunities specifically tailored for architecture professionals.

The STEM category of Category-Based Express Entry includes a range of occupations, including not only architects but also Engineers, Software Developers, Web Developers, and more.

The Targeted Express Entry Draws for Architects present a great opportunity for eligible candidates to obtain permanent residency in Canada. This article aims to provide valuable insights and guidance to architecture professionals who aspire to immigrate to Canada through Targeted Express Entry.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Understanding Category-Based Express Entry

Express Entry serves as a comprehensive system managed by the Canadian government to facilitate applications for permanent residency. Designed to attract skilled individuals who can contribute to the country’s growth, Express Entry opens doors for architecture professionals to obtain permanent residency in Canada while enjoying numerous benefits.

Canada has introduced category-based rounds of invitations, wherein candidates are evaluated based on specific criteria set by the Minister to fulfill economic objectives. These criteria include proficiency in French, relevant work experience in specific NOC (National Occupational Classification) codes, and other general Express Entry requirements.

The Canadian government has introduced category-based selections within Express Entry, allowing targeted draws based on specific skills, training, or language abilities. So far Canada has conducted three Targeted Express Entry Draws, held on June 28,  July 5, and July 6, and invited around 2,500 candidates from the Healthcare and STEM categories. These are six categories under the Category-Based Express Entry:

  • French-language proficiency
  • STEM occupations
  • Healthcare occupations
  • Trade occupations
  • Transport occupations
  • Agriculture and Agri-food Occupations

These draws aim to invite skilled individuals with in-demand skills to apply for permanent residency in Canada.

Canada Targeted Express Entry Draw for Healthcare Workers ~ 1500 Invitations

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Targeted Express Entry for Architecture Professionals

Architecture professionals have the opportunity to participate in the Targeted Express Entry Draws conducted by Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada (IRCC). It is important to note that eligibility for Targeted Express Entry also necessitates eligibility for one of the three federal economic immigration programs: the Federal Skilled Worker Program, the Canadian Experience Class, or the Federal Skilled Trades Program.

Eligible Occupations for Targeted Express Entry Draw

The Targeted Occupations List for architecture professionals includes the following occupations, each corresponding to a specific NOC code. Candidates applying under this category must have accumulated at least 6 months of continuous work experience within the past 3 years in a single occupation listed below:

Occupation NOC Code
Architects 21200
Architecture and science managers 20011
Landscape Architects 21201
Urban and land use planners 21202

Pro Tip: Seek the assistance of experienced immigration experts or refer to the official website for an accurate NOC Code, as you might be eligible for the Targeted Express Entry.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”14230″ animation=”None” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Prepare for Targeted Express Entry with ELAAR!

[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Let’s Talk” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/contact-us” margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]

How to Apply for Targeted Express Entry as an Architecture Professional

To apply for Targeted Express Entry as an architecture professional, follow these steps:

Determine your Eligibility: Make sure you meet the eligibility criteria for the targeted occupation category. This includes having a minimum of 6 months of continuous work experience in a single occupation listed in the Targeted Occupations List for architecture professionals. It’s also important to meet other requirements set by the federal immigration programs.

Language Proficiency: Show your proficiency in English or French by taking the accepted language tests for Express Entry. Accepted tests for English include CELPIP or IELTS General, while for French, you can take the TEF or TCF.

Express Entry Profile: Visit the official Canadian government website and create an online profile for Express Entry. Provide accurate and up-to-date information about your education, work experience, language proficiency, and other relevant details.

Boost Your CRS Score: Maximize your Comprehensive Ranking System (CRS) score by focusing on areas such as language proficiency, education, work experience, and additional factors like Canadian education or work experience, provincial nomination, or a valid job offer. Seeking professional guidance can help optimize your profile and enhance your chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) in the Targeted Express Entry Draw for architecture professionals.

Targeted Express Entry Draw: Receive an invitation to apply in a Targeted Express Entry Draw for Architectural Occupations. An ITA is required to apply for permanent residency under the Express Entry program.

Submitting an Application: Upon receiving an ITA, you’ll be given a specific timeframe to submit a complete application for permanent residency. Ensure you compile all the required documents accurately and submit them within the given timeframe.

Medical Examinations and Security Checks: After submitting your application, you may need to undergo a medical examination to meet the health requirements for immigration. Additionally, security checks will be conducted as part of the application process.

Application Processing: Your application will be processed by the relevant immigration authorities. The processing time may vary, but you can track the status of your application online.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”14231″ animation=”None” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

How Does Colossus Migration Help Architects?

Our expert team understands the unique needs of architects in the Canadian architecture industry and is committed to maximizing your chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) as an architectural professional.

We will assist in assessing your eligibility, analyzing your Express Entry profile, and identifying areas for improvement to enhance your CRS score. With our guidance, you can optimize your work experience, education, and other factors to meet the requirements of the Targeted Express Entry Draw for architectural professionals.

For a limited time, eligible architectural professionals can sign up with us for as low as CAD $999 to benefit from our comprehensive services, which include:

  • Submission of a complete and accurate Express Entry profile and/or PNP Expression of Interest
  • Support with preparing documents in advance in anticipation of receiving an ITA
  • One-on-one ZOOM appointment with an RCIC to discuss your personalized case
  • On-going support from an RCIC throughout the process and even after

Contact us today to receive our expert and personalized assistance. excerpt.rendered: Are you an architect seeking to immigrate to Canada through the Targeted Express Entry? Here is a comprehensive guide on Targeted Express Entry for Architectural Occupations.
